title: Does my future wife live in OKC? (REAL AD HERE)
text:
Hello ladies! I realize this ad is long but if you're looking to spend the rest of your life with someone, it should be appreciated rather than an inconvenience. The more you can learn about me upfront, the better. What I'm hoping to find is my future wife, plain and simple and I don't care how far and wide I have to search as long as there's a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow! I'm finally at the stage where I realize, there's nothing more important on earth than waking up every morning with the person you're supposed to be with. That would make this life's journey so much more fulfilling and definitely easier than tackling the world on your own. I would even take that over winning the lottery because the fact is, a lot of rich people are lonely. Don't get me wrong, I'm not looking to run out and elope tomorrow because I'm a little more realistic than that! Relationships take time to develop and futures have to be carefully planned out but I do want someone who's ready to settle down and is willing to take a chance. This means you're not afraid to put your heart on the table. Some would say that Craigslist is the last place a person should hope to find their soulmate but why not? You're on here, I'm on here and doesn't everyone else who gets on here shop at the same grocery stores we do? Considering those facts, who cares where you meet someone as long as you're compatible? We can always tell our friends and family that we bumped into each other at Safeway!

I decided to start off by creating a list of "must have's". The idea was to go back in time and reminisce about the experiences I had from my past relationships. I thought about what worked for me, what didn't and ended up putting together a top 5 list. Please pay equal attention to all of it because each category is very important to me and they are things I can't live without. I truly believe that if we agree on the whole 1-5 list, we'll probably be successful but I also feel that if just one of them are missing, we won't stand a chance. I don't know about you, but I'm tired of wasting years of my life away with the wrong partners. Most of the women I've dated in the past have been out of convenience which is the route a lot of people take. Either we happened to live right next door to each other, worked together or got set up through mutual friends but I've never actually been with anyone that I got to pick out for myself. More often than not, the best things in life don't come easy and you can't expect them to fall into your lap. If you want to find something that's going to be real and lasting, it's probably going to require some work with the same passion and commitment that you should put into a relationship. With that being said, my efforts are going towards getting the woman I want this time around and I'm either going to hit the jackpot or go home empty handed! 

Now onto my 1-5 list...

#1. COMMUNICATION - This is at the very top of my list. I don't care how attracted you are to each other, how much you have in common or how great the chemistry is between you. If you can't problem solve, your relationship has no where to go. It's as simple as that. What this requires is having the ability to convey what's wrong in a tactful manner, the willingness to compromise and a forgiving spirit whenever problems arise because you can rest assure they will! Those who can't do this end up being single or in and out of relationships their entire lives. I also think that never going to bed angry is a great policy to have! You might not be ready to talk out your differences yet, but you can at least wave a white flag and end the fight so the both of you can get a good night's sleep. Then you can work it out the next day after everything has calmed down. That's so much better than lying there all night pissed off with your heart racing isn't it? One thing leads into another and the next thing you know, you're having trouble functioning the next day at work because you're tired and still upset. It's not worth it. Some people actually think it's cool to be stubborn but on the contrary, it's a good way to age faster and find yourself alone in the end. 

#2. SEX - This is a two-part section because sex is so important in most relationships/marriages that it's often times the "deal breaker". It's not uncommon for someone to cheat or break up and move onto someone else when they're unhappy with their sex life. That's why I'm going to talk details here. I want to make sure that the woman I attract is the right one for me so we never run into that problem! 

PART 1. (My sexual habits...)

I think it's safe to say that I'm not like most men in this area! For one thing, I don't have much of an interest in strip clubs, porn or dirty magazines which eliminates at least 50% of the male population! However, if those things turn my lady on, I'll be happy to explore them with her but never on my own. In addition to that, I don't cheat or desire other women when I already have one nor do I fantasize about having a mÃƒÂƒÃ†Â’ÃƒÂ‚Ã†Â’ÃƒÂƒÃ¢Â€ÂšÃƒÂ‚Ã‚Â©nage a trios with two girls. That takes care of the other 50%! I don't really like being the center of attention because my personality is more along the lines of a pleaser who's unselfish in bed. In other words, I'd rather focus on fulfilling your needs than my own. To give you an idea, there have been occasions when I've made a girl cum a couple of times but then quit without taking care of myself. If I know that you're finished and past the point of enjoyment, I try not to overdo it! Don't get me wrong because I do get mine in most of the time, but I will always put you first. 

PART 2. (A special perk that I'm offering...) 

What I don't get about most people is that they do all of their experimenting while they're single. They would rather explore their sexuality with "casual acquaintances" than with their soulmate. Then when they finally settle down, they make their marriages boring as hell! It becomes the same old stale routine day after day which often leads to someone cheating. It doesn't make any sense at all. I think the fun stuff should be done with the person you're going to spend the rest of your life with! That's who you should be opening up to about your sexual desires. Maybe marriages would last longer if that were the case. With that being said, everyone has their fetishes and things that turn them on the most. Mine happens to be watching my lady get fucked by another guy! There's nothing hotter on earth than that and it's a huge aphrodisiac for me. It took me years to figure this out about myself and then I had to learn to accept it but now that I have, I want my future wife to enjoy this perk! Most men would have a fit if their woman expressed the desire to have sex with someone else but I will reward you for your honesty and that's a promise! Don't get me wrong, I'm not looking for a girl who's going to be promiscuous and sleep with every Tom, Dick and Harry that comes along, but I will definitely let you explore your sexuality and enjoy being a woman! I'm even open to finding a regular that we call up whenever you're in the mood for a little extra attention. As long as there are no pregnancies, diseases or emotional attachments, I'll have no problem with that whatsoever! There's a big difference between having sex and making love. I'm willing to share my woman's body but not her heart, mind or affection. Those are things I want all to myself! Honesty is the key here and if everything is out on the table, lying and cheating should never be an issue.

#3. QUALITY TIME - I don't understand couples who live under the same roof and merely co-exist together. They barely even talk to each other and just go through the motions every day like robots. The woman is usually multitasking with a cell phone attached to her ear as she's making dinner and yelling at the kids to quiet down while the man is drinking a beer and watching the game with a friend. This is just an analogy but you get the point. By the time the evening is over, they haven't spent one second of quality time together all day long. This goes on month after month, year after year and then they can't figure out how their marriage failed! Although nights like that are expected, there also needs to be a balance. The typical "ho hum" attitude doesn't work for me and it just isn't in my DNA. I'm a passionate person who likes to go out and do things that are fun with the lady I'm sharing my life with and I also need to feel a strong connection there as well. The whole purpose for me is to have a best friend, a partner and a companion who I'm deeply in love with, not just a roommate. To achieve this, you have to be creative at times in order to keep the fire going in your relationship or the flame will die out. Nothing runs on automatic pilot.

#4. AFFECTION - I tried to be in a relationship before where the woman was non-affectionate and that doesn't work for me. Human touch is a beautiful thing and it can be a lonely world without it. I love to hug, kiss, cuddle and feel close to the person I'm with. I'm not talking about smothering your partner or attaching yourself to them like glue because everyone needs their personal space, but it's nice to come home to someone who will wrap their arms around you when you've had a long, exhausting day!

#5. TEAMWORK - I don't believe in gender roles. Just because I'm a man doesn't mean I can't shop or that my woman can't mow the lawn. I have never agreed with that old fashioned philosophy. I think the responsibilities should be divvied up according to who's better at what. That's how your household will run smoother and more efficiently. Then, whatever is left over is either done together or you take turns. Teamwork is about defending each other as well. This means when someone is talking shit behind my back, you'll speak out on my behalf since I'm not there to protect myself. Some women will just sit there and let the person carry on without ever saying a word or they'll even join in! That's not right and you'll never have to worry about that on my end because I don't tolerate people saying negative things about my woman. Especially to my face. Teamwork also applies to finances. You both contribute to the bills but you also carry each other through tough times. In other words... If I lose my job, you'll step up and support the household until I can find something else (without giving me a hard time about it) just like I would do for you. It's bad enough to be unemployed. The last thing you need is your significant other making it worse for you. Relationships are a partnership and there are enough people in the world who don't care about you so the least you can do is care for each other. I've been with women in the past who moved in with me and didn't pay a thing for months which no one had a problem with but the rare times when I needed to lean on my lady, I got treated like shit and reminded every day of how she's not going to support a man. To sum it up, selfish women like that have no place in my life. 

Well, that's my 1-5 list. Please don't "cherry pick" through it and disregard the things you don't like! If you feel that you have to do that, then we are not a match. This is about finding the person I'm spending the rest of my life with so it's very important that we're on the same page with ALL of those points. If you feel that we are, then I would like to hear your thoughts on each one of them. Please include that with your response in as much detail as you can. I realize that the list doesn't cover everything because how you live, what your personal goals are, habits, pet peeves, etc. are important to know as well but I think it's a great start! 

My views on marriage and divorce...

Most of us have made mistakes in the past so I'm not here to judge you for yours nor do I want you to judge me for mine. However, my thoughts for the future is to never get a divorce. I don't even want that to be an option. As long as there is no cheating or physical abuse going on, I think everything else can be worked out. There are stages to go through before getting a divorce should even be considered. If you can't talk out your differences one on one, then you should go and get marital counseling. If that doesn't work, then either try another therapist or call for a separation to let things calm down. In the meantime, you both look to find solutions that can bring you back together again. This is how it should be. People get married now a days with the thought in mind that they can always get a divorce if it doesn't work out. That's flat out bullshit (excuse my French) and it defeats the purpose of getting married in the first place. You might as well just be in a relationship if you're going to think along those lines. Marriage is a life long commitment and I want someone who's going to take it as seriously as I am.

Also, I have many personal interests but it would take me all day to list every one of them so I'll just give you my top 10 not necessarily in order! Let me know what we have in common here as well...

#1. Camping & fishing
#2. Kayaking/boating
#3. Going for long drives and taking photos of the scenic points
#4. Snuggling up together and watching a good movie
#5. Cooking, having BBQ's and trying out new restaurants
#6. Going to the zoo and the aquarium
#7. Checking out a comedy club
#8. Listening to music, singing karaoke and seeing live bands
#9. Watching professional sports
10. Being festive and celebrating holidays, birthdays, anniversaries, etc. 


Finally, I used to have an age preference but now I'm not sure what I want! I'm attracted to younger girls but then I have to put up with the games and immaturity. Especially with sex. They're still using it to get things in life like a promotion, a guy with money or a baby for themselves and they haven't figured out yet that it's fun and feels good! The older women understand that completely so the sex is there without all the BS but then you have to put up with the stubbornness, how set in their ways they are and the bitter taste they still have in their mouths from their former marriages. The younger women are more open about planning a future together because they have a whole life ahead of them but it's hard to relate to this era concerning the styles, the lingo, the music and especially the mentality. The older women are from a generation that hits home so you have that in common but you can forget having a future with them because they already have their car, their house, their career, their children, etc. and they want to keep it all to themselves! It's a crap shoot but if I were to pick a side, I would either have to go with a younger woman who has an old soul or a woman my age who's not emotionally damaged and looks young! 

The only real preference I have is that I'm not interested in heavyset girls. That includes the terms "thick" and "BBW". I'm attracted to women who have anywhere from an average to thin build and look feminine. Don't get me wrong, your physical make up won't be near as important as your intangibles are and to make my point... have you ever been with someone you could pass by a dozen times in a grocery store and never notice them but the more you got to know that person, the more attractive they became? That's what counts more than anything because it can work the other way too. There are members of the opposite sex that are so attractive you can trip over yourself looking at them but as soon as they open their mouth, it all goes downhill a hurry! So I'm really not the superficial type. I just have a preference. 

As for me...

Don't expect a male model here with the body of a professional athlete. If that's a craving you have, I can always bring one home gift wrapped for your enjoyment! I consider myself an average looking guy but I do take pride in having above average qualities. You can find more attractive men on Craigslist or anywhere else in the world for that matter but the type of relationship I'm offering along with how you'll be treated is like finding a needle in a haystack! title: The Walk
text:
The Walk

A man steps, one foot in front of the other. He is walking the streets of his home town. He is wearing the basic style of a modern Joe. Blue jeans, semi plaid button down casual shirt un-tucked, a light blue jacket with no real logos, and a pair of black and brown yet simple hiking boots. He is walking with his head up and his eyes down. The calm breeze coming from the west slightly pushes his dirty blond hair up and over, just a little in the front, all while he marches onto the oncoming headwinds. 

His face is still, calm yet perplexed. His mind wonders all over as he keeps moving forward, not knowing or concerned where the sidewalk will end. You can see his brain computing something through his eyes, as each step from his body to feet are on auto-pilot. 

The small crowds on the concrete boardwalk pass him by in both directions. There are single bodies moving, couples trotting while they hold each other's hand, the white hair old man stepping 10" inches at a time while he gets his daily exercise with a battered walking cane, and the occasional jogger in the gutter all dressed up for a marathon running for his or her next 5K competition. Each person is caring only for themselves, not knowing what the next is thinking. They are chit-chatting on a cell phone, texting, and sprinting furiously to get to work on time. Still no one cares for each other. 

Why? 

He does, our hero, our savior, but the weight of the world, the love of a woman has left him over and over again. It only gets him to new heights of a friendship with a love, just to be bulldozed into the landfill below for the hundredth time. Why should he care, why should he try again, why can't he just live in freedom with some amazing affection, just with one perfect person? 

The experiences he has traveled though each lost love is a hunger in his heart, in his mind. Today is a bad day, today is a day of remembrance, and today he strolls the noisy streets of the city to quiet his mind. He does not understand where his path will take him. Where he will end up today or tomorrow, yet he does have hope. He knows that God has a plan, even if he is blind to it, he knows. Job, home, love is all in store but when? Why is it so hard? The job seems to be in place, a home is there, and the woman, well she is not. With every thought he keeps to himself a final conclusion to each pursuit of happiness, what if? 

The intermission of thoughts is always, LOVE IS POSITIVE, ALWAYS AND FOREVER. 

This simple phrase keeps him sane; to keep trying his shot at love, again and again, even if it means failure a 1,000 times till that one finally comes true to him. 

As he comes to the corner of the street a beam of sun light reflects off of something. Jerking his head, he adjusts his eyes over to that original location that caused his distraction. As the blinding light fades, his focus clears, there is a woman who blends into picture. 

She is simply beautiful, she is simply stunning; she is all stone cold business like, yet fragile in every way. She is simply breathe taking in her motionless sculpture stance. She then sips her coffee waiting for the light to change to WALK. The dark coat wraps around her tiny waist, her heals strengthen her calves that are below the long skirt in which she is wearing. In the breeze, her powerful, straight, shimmering long black hair is calmly waving to the right side of her shoulder. 

The RED hand changes to a white WALK. . .

In opposite directions, they start to cross the same intersection. Midway, she catches this handsome stranger, she is just lost in his splendor. Her eyes are focused on one thing, him. The coffee cup slowly leaves her open mouth. At the center of the intersection they meet and then it happens. . .

J.D.E. 2011 Revised 2016

text:
In life, a lot of us make life changing decisions based on things we don't want for example being alone for the rest of our lives so we get married or jump straight into relationships just to avoid this negative idea that only has dominion over you if you let it. We fail or find fault in our decisions because we did bot make such decisions based on what we actually wanted instead. This leads to frustration, loneliness, infidelity, divorce and many other things you don't have to endure.

I want to help you overcome these obstacles in your marriage or intimate relationships. I've been doing this for a few years now and I have been very successful at opening new doors and perspectives for people in relationships on the brink of shattering. Sometimes it can be hard to come to a decision and you need the support and perspective of the infinite possibilities you have access to. title: ISO my future Queen
text:
The first time I posted this it yielded less than stellar results. The few that did respond were scammers, prostitutes and the one that showed some potential ended abruptly and left me scratching my head asking: What the hell just happened? I AM NOT just looking for a "good time" and want to be 100% clear about my intentions.

Just recently ended up in OK and I don't know a soul out here yet. I will be here for the next 6 months but would consider relocating for the right person.

I'm not a vain person and understand that a mutual attraction is necessary but if you're basing what could turn out to be your "soul mate" off a single picture and not even taking the time to try and get to know them; you're not serious at all. Everyone wants perfect but unfortunately most of us are not. Perfectly flawed does exist; perfect doesn't. I seen a meme recently that said: Most women want Superman but walk past Clark Kent everyday. 

Here is a bit about me and what I am looking for:

I am a 43 year old divorced father who actually gets along with my ex quite well. 
I am a fixer and problem solver. I enjoy making people happy more then anything in the world and have been told that I am the epitome of a "Southern Gentleman" even though I am not from the south originally. I own my home, cars, pay my bills, have decent credit, work every day, keep a neat home (not a clean freak but not a slob either) and for the most part have my act together. I hope to meet someone that shares the same values and interests. I enjoy performance cars, riding ATVs, golfing, taking rides out in the country exploring the back roads, cooking or going out for dinner and conversation that lasts until the wee hours of the morning.

I would really like to find someone that is: witty with a good sense of humor, has good communication skills, open minded and just enjoys life in general. That can be staying at home watching a movie or going out and trying something completely different. My dream girl would be someone that is loves being feminine yet is still not afraid to get dirty. 

The items that I am looking for in a relationship are the big 3 of course but not limited to: Love, Caring and Trust. I really want to be with someone that I can't imagine spending a day without. Someone that I can get lost in conversation with and wonder where all the hours went. Someone that I can wake up next to and thank God that I was blessed with another day to be with her. Someone that I feel so lucky to have that I never quit trying to impress her. Someone to hold my hand and tell me it's going to be ok when times get rough. Someone that will accept how much love I have to offer. Someone that will never quit...

I am open to anyone 25 to 45ish and if this peaks your interest by all means contact me.

title: Would you date my dad? (Trust me it's worth the read)
text:
Good evening Oklahoma City, I am writing you from far away. I am trying to find someone I deem worthy to date my "dad". Now he's not "really" my dad. He's someone who ran my group home. He gave many kids a father figure when they had none. It's part of the reason I am doing this. Is it awkward? Yes. Is it real? Indeed. So let me explain why I am here for him (He might be a tad embarrassed when he finds out). About 3 years ago he got divorced. Rather than starting over up here he decided he was really going to start over. He moved to Oklahoma City from the east coast and did just that. He is pretty settled there. I know he has a good job, a place to live and a newish car. He has made some friends but as well as I know him I know he really wants a family life. I can wish him a happy fathers day (Which I know is a bit far away) but I want to help him find a family the way he stepped in for us. So here's what you need to know.

He's pretty nerdy
He is very thoughtful
He loves kids (Single moms are welcome, I'm sure)
He is over weight, that being said he has lost more than 100 pounds since I met him so he's in a much better spot.
He's both mature and immature. You can talk to him about politics or get great advice from him but he will still spend a Saturday afternoon playing video games.

I can't tell you who can and can't respond. But I will be sending him the best few responses. So here's what I would like to see. 

As I mentioned single mom's are fine but you must work. He has a great job but I don't want to see someone try and exploit that.
Either have kids young enough for him to be able to play a big part in raising them or want kids... Or both!
He tells me part of the reason he struggles out there is everyone wants a "country boy". He isn't that at all. It's okay for you to be a countryish woman so long as you have other interests too. 
I don't want someone too big. I know that sounds hypocritical but as I mentioned I saw him at 360 and he posted a pic of him on the scale the other day and he was at 250. I know it's important for him to keep going that way for health reasons.
Also, this is a big one. My pops is very much socially liberal. He believes in marriage equality, a woman's right to her own privacy when it comes to healthcare decisions. He is attracted to white women but other than attraction doesn't see color. 

If any of this sounds interesting send me an email and tell me why it sounds interesting to you. Tell me where you see "matching up". Send me a picture or two and preferably a way he can contact you. If I just forward him the emails you send it won't allow him to reply, or at least it didn't when I tried to sell something for a friend. Thanks for reading and have a great day!

Oh I posted a pic of silent bob for those of you who don't know who that is. It's the best I could do without actually putting his pic up. Picture this with short buzzed hair and you at least have an idea.
kids, want: Wants kids but has none of his own.

title: Movie Lover
text:
I love movies and TV.
Not just the blockbusters or the popular shows, but a wide wide range of stuff - from current to classics on TCM.
Here is an example of what I watched over the weekend - Everest, The Apple, Liberal Arts, Lost After Dark, The Scorch Trials, Mockingjay Part 2, Heroes Reborn (tv). I also like foreign films (subtitles rule!) like My Life as a Dog, Kurosawa films, Prince of the Sun. To me, Gravity in IMAX 3D was the best immersive use of 3D.

I don't claim to be a great thinker or write dissertations on the films/shows I watch...I am not that deep. I just enjoy them as they are and if I gleam a subtle meaning or not it's ok. I can always look it up on imdb and see what other people have to say afterwards..haha. I listen to a few movie-related podcasts while at work - Doug Loves Movies, Comedy Film Nerds and How Did This Get Made? along with a few other comedic based ones like Welcome to Nightvale, Never Not Funny, and Comedy Bang Bang.

It'd be fun to be able to share that love of all things video with someone who has those same interests.

So on to more about me...
I am 52, divorced, roommated (for now), work FT M-F, no kids, don't smoke, don't do drugs, drink wine/mixed drinks on occasion, out of shape at the moment (a couch potato that is fat? go figure...lol). I am not religious or spiritual.

title: What kind of women look at these personals?
text:
(I decided to remove my pic because, even though this is clearly m4w.. guys are still messaging me being all weird trying to get at me or something.. I've got nothing against it but I don't swing that way and its getting annoying..)

This is a long shot, but I suppose it's worth a try just for the hell of it.

I don't like talking about myself, because anyone can do that. Not everyone means what they say. I am unlike a lot of men in that I am extremely attuned to emotions and feelings of those around me. I have good relationships with the women in my life, and tend to make good platonic connections. 

I have good relationships with all the women in my life and always have. I am still good friends with every woman I've ever been in a relationship with, and have many female friends who I talk to on a regular basis.. but I don't think of any of them romantically, and I am ready to seek out someone that fills that role to me so I can pour myself into them.

If it would be useful to hear these words come from my mouth or others' mouths close to me, I'd go ahead and do that.

However, this is a spontaneous post and I don't have the ability or the time set aside to conduct interviews and such to better convey my message. So I'll just hit the important stuff that comes to mind, and the rest can be sorted out with communication.

--- DISCLAIMERS & IMPORTANT POINTS --- 

- I am passionate about helping people and promoting positive change. 

- I am dedicated to self-improvement of the mind and body, and have been my entire life.

- I am accustomed to living on little to no income. Money comes and goes. I have plans to escape the class position of being poor but I have learned to be happy with where I am and make the most of it.

- I have been developing my own web-based business for more than a decade, and am evaluating candidates and refining the features and mechanisms all the time.

- I am very social, but I need to be a recluse at times. I spend a lot of time with friends, but I've grown up from the typical college kid and I'm much more responsible than most people who say they like to party. I like the occasional party as long as I'm with intelligent and responsible people.

- I have a reputation for being crazy. Truthfully I am misunderstood. I enjoy a challenge and I push myself to the limit. I am not abrasive and I try to diffuse violence and aggression whenever possible.. although I admit I enjoy fighting for recreation casually.

- I am intelligent and an embodiment of a lot of things counter-cultural, but I accept everyone for who they are. I am respected highly by my peers and have a tendency to either own the room I'm in with active engagement or to be off working on my own thing listening to those around me.

- I love pretty much everyone.. but love comes in many forms. I love everyone in that I care about them and appreciate their uniqueness, I look out for the well-being of those who I can. But I have the capacity to love romantically so much deeper and more profoundly that it cannot compare to the love I could share with anyone else.



--- WHAT I'M LOOKING FOR IN A WOMAN ---

- I want a companion, but you never know who might end up being there reliably in such a way for the rest of your life.. so I'd like to take it slow, and not jump into anything.. but I don't see other women and would lose interest if you saw other men romantically while we were talking like that. I haven't been physically intimate in nearly two years because I know that it will be better when I find the right person, and I need someone patient in that way as well.

- I am endlessly passionate and romantic internally and will feel your pain before my own. I need someone who loves themselves enough to let me care for them without being hung up on feeling as if you don't deserve it. Love yourself, be a positive influence around you.

- I need someone who I can learn from and who is willing to communicate openly. I am more critical of intelligence than physical attractiveness but some degree of both is necessary to hold my interest.

- I have learned from my past relationships in such a way that I have no baggage from them. I am a happy and confident person who isn't in a rush to find connection.. I am just looking out for the right person who is non-judgmental to others, open-minded, and interested in many things.

- I enjoy sensitivity and conversation. Having the capacity to be sensitive without letting it make you vulnerable and being open to conversation and discussion is important to me.

- I'm looking for a woman who enjoys athletic and outdoor activities like running or soccer or fitness in general, but I'm not critical of anybody who lacks discipline because nobody is perfect. Also, you have to love to learn and love a challenge to be with me.. but I am not a typical challenge, because I work with you instead of against you. I feed off mutual engagement of a productive nature.

...

I could go on and on and on. But as I draw it out, less and less will feel interested in committing to reading a daunting block of text. However, this is already long enough to act as a litmus test of sorts to filter out those unwilling to look at things more deeply.

If you're willing to go more deeply, email me and we'll talk. I'm lazy with replies sometimes but I'm honest and straightforward and you will come to find that nobody that knows me has anything to say to the contrary.

If you're the type who needs to see a picture of me before we speak (another picture), then send me yours before asking. I don't enforce the body image brainwashing that the media has drilled into the skull of every woman that holds them to unrealistic and disturbing standards.. So just send a bad picture (fully clothed please, lol), but know that I'll sense any misdirection when we talk if you're being deceptive, and then I'll lose interest. I have worked as a psychic consultant for over a year and even though I don't claim to have any supernatural abilities, I have gotten pretty good at it. 

Let's be honest with one another though. I'm not shallow but I have expectations. I'm looking for someone who could be a part of my future. 

Email me with who you're voting for and a question that piques your interest if you're interested in initiating a dialogue.

title: *** LET ME LOVE YOU*** by SG
text:
Let me love you
when skies are grey,
as rain pours down
and hope gives way.

Let me love you
when cold sets in,
as frozen dreams 
are slow to begin.

Let me love you
when things go wrong,
as failures mount
their victory song.

Let me love you
when grace gives way,
as forgiveness finds
it hard to stay.

Let me love you
when doubts give rise,
as faith is foiled 
amongst the lies.

Let me love you
when no one cares,
as hearts desires
meet lonely stares.

Let me love you
when life's a mess,
as walls cave in
and you feel less.

Let me love you
when most of all,
as chance is given,
and you begin to fall.

Written by_ SG
Copyright 2016

title: Corny Seeking a Field
text:
So, how does one speak of himself whilst avoiding the mundanity of listing allegedly appealing adjectives?

Let's see...

I am a lover of words. The intellect, the will to reason and imagine; to conceive a conversation through the ecstatic consummation of thoughts intertwined in the radical twists of Mobius' infinity, this is what I value. I love beautiful women: the curves crying out to be indulged by the gentle cosset of loving fingers; the eyes pulling at the soul of a man with Sagittarius A Star's ineluctable fanaticism; the lips promising the undying sweetness of ambrosia. I love beautiful women, but I find there is no true beauty without a mind for inquiry, for dreams, for the entertainment of the ostensibly unattainable, as if what can be perceived through the serenity of a quiet mind is within one's grasp, regardless of how fantastic it is.

Perhaps it's too lofty. 

Is there a woman of whom I can say, this is my heart of hearts? Is there a woman who can accept the seemingly contradictory personality of a man who, at once, would give the shirt off his back whilst plotting a visit to a nursing home dressed as the Grim Reaper? Is there a woman who could put up with the intellect of Archimedes juxtaposed to the same mind's affinity for the juvenile (and inappropriate) fabrication of double entendre from innocuous statements? Is there a woman who can accept the gloom of a man too cynical to believe anything at face value whilst simultaneously believing with an unfortunately childlike exuberance that "the one" is not merely a simple matter of sleep disrupting pipe dreams, which denude the heart of all pretention of being a lion without a pride?

While I doubt such a woman can be found on the likes of Craigslist, I figure I've nothing to lose if this offers an avenue to a meaningful friendship.

What about you?

I imagine you enjoy laughter, wrong or right, at the mundane and ludicrous. I imagine your heart breaks at the sight of a hungry child or mistreated animal. I imagine, my friend, that a clean walk along a river's edge inspires a modicum of harmony with the world, whilst one defiled by the leavings of people who forget the earth is their only home inspires disdain. I imagine the poetry I write you will move you, while the thought of the last minute purchase of a thoughtless bit of matter would leave you believing I don't really care. 

That you take no shit; that you are brutal in your honesty; that your integrity matters more to you than what people think; that you are as willing to allow me to please you as you are to please me; that you don't mind your toes curling in the exquisite agony invoked by the wickedness of my tongue, these are the things that are the gateway to my devotion.

And if you should find that you've come to this point of the ad without vomiting or believing me too far removed from the reality of this rat race we call dating, it'd likely be worth your while to communicate with me.

Of course, I cannot promise you Prince Charming, Denzel Washington level beauty, or the wealth of a man with fingers about the world's throat, but I can promise you a man.

title: Is there really not more to life than this...
text:
This will probably be poorly written and way longer than it should be but, it is what it is.... 

So, you find someone you like or maybe love.... You date, you get married, you have kids.... You wake up, you go to work, you stress about your job, come home, cook dinner, do some laundry and dishes, deal with the kids and go to bed.... Time moves faster than your mind and before you know it your ten years older..... The person you fell in love with and built the perfet life with (or so you thought) is no longer the same person..... you bicker about the dumbest stuff.... You rarely get a kiss before you leave home.... You don't get calls or texts just to say hi only to say there's another issue..... It's the same mundane routine day in and day out!!
Is this really how we were intended to live our life? 
Your only supposed to get one shot at happiness and love and that's it? 
If anyone out there has advice or insight or wants to chat and possibly give a different perspective.... Email me.

title: Lookin for mother daughter team
text:
I'm looking for 2 non smoking ladies who are tired of living in the concrete jungle, & are wanting to move out of Okc. If that means selling your small wood frame home or one of the small brick ones from the 70's, then this would be an upgrade for you. Although I will admit Edmond isn't a perfect place to live either. I'm wanting to drive a truck again so I need a house/cat sitter. I won't be home for 30 days at a time. If one or both of you want to go on the road with me just for fun or to make us $100k per yr driving team, that might work too. Btw, when I say jungle, I'm not making a racist comment. For the past 30 yrs, even when I was stationed at Tinker, it felt like I was leaving a concrete jungle as I left town. Still does today. Be aware though, we do have crazy drivers here too, that will honk at you for no good reason. These morons around here will still cut underneath you into the left turn lane, even though it's illegal to cross those yellow lines & edmond PD has made that quite clear. It's also illegal to change lanes within I think 100 ft of an intersection and/or when it's a solid line. I'm not sure, but I think there's a Mr. Magoo driving school located close by.

If you have substance abuse problems, pass me by. Life is hard enough without being self destructive. If you are a light drinker, but not a mean drunk, that might be ok.

I will also add that the ideal lady or ladies will have good hearing, & not have her head up her ass while she's running the household. Sorry to be blunt, but if you can't even make sure the faucet is completely turned off or you leave the outdoor lights on even in the daytime, you are probably too dingy for me. I have good hearing & always keep the tv turned down as low as possible. My cat also likes the peace & quiet too. It's really a safety issue too. When you hear a strange noise, you have to investigate what it is. One time I had to get up in the middle of the night to discover my cat was playing inside a box.

This house also has high ceilings too, so if you require it to be below 78 in the summertime or warmer than 68 in the winter, this might not be the place for you. This is not a resort hotel, where the utilities are free. I do plan on putting in new insulated siding, & new windows if the earthquakes ever stop, but these days, every reasonable adult that pays their own bills, knows you have to dress for the weather. Of course, if you want to pay the utility bills, power to you. I remember when I was in college, I had a girl living with me that would turn the heat up to 80 while I was at work. She forgot to turn it back down when she left, & that's how I figured it out. Yeah, people who don't pay utility bills do that sort of thing;
